meanings.sent1: The downcome of the elevator was smooth and steady.
meanings.sent2: I watched the leaves' downcome from the tree in autumn.
meanings.sent3: The downcome of the ball hitting the ground made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The downcome of the waterfall was a breathtaking sight.
meanings.sent5: The sudden downcome of the airplane made my stomach drop.

meanings.definition: A setback or decline in fortune or status.
meanings.sent1: The company faced a significant downcome after the economic crisis.
meanings.sent2: Her unexpected downcome in the competition surprised everyone.
meanings.sent3: Despite the downcome, he remained optimistic and determined.
meanings.sent4: The downcome in his grades served as a wake-up call for him.
meanings.sent5: The downcome in their relationship was a turning point for both of them.
